}}  'McGill University' is a public research university located in
Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Founded in 1821 during the British colonial era, the
university bears the name of James McGill, a prominent Montreal merchant from
Glasgow, Scotland and alumnus of Glasgow University, whose bequest formed the
beginning of the university. Several colleges and universities were established
by McGill, including the University of British Columbia, which was known as the
McGill University College of British Columbia until 1915, the University of
Victoria, an affiliated junior college of McGill until 1916, and Dawson College
which began in 1945 as a satellite campus of McGill to absorb the anticipated
influx of students after World War II. In addition, McGill medical graduate and
former professor, William Osler, was among the four founders and early faculty
members of the Johns Hopkins University medical
school. http://www.hopkinsmedicine.org/about/history/history5.html
Both founders of the University of Alberta, Premier Alexander Cameron Rutherford
and Henry Marshall Tory, were also McGill alumni.

With almost 215,000 living alumni worldwide, students and professors at McGill
have been recognized in fields ranging from the arts and sciences, to business,
politics, diplomacy, and sports. Notable alumni include eight Nobel Laureates,
one hundred and thirty-four Rhodes Scholars (more than any other Canadian university), http://publications.mcgill.ca/reporter/2012/11/runner-mccuaig-
to-hit-the-rhodes/ three astronauts, two Canadian prime ministers, twelve
justices of the Canadian Supreme Court, These are Douglas Abbott, Ian
Binnie, Louis-Philippe Brodeur, Claire L'Heureux-DubÃ©, Marie Deschamps, Morris
Fish, DÃ©sirÃ© Girouard, Louis-Philippe de GrandprÃ©, Gerald Le Dain, Charles
Gonthier, Pierre-Basile Mignault, and Thibaudeau Rinfret four foreign
leaders, twenty-eight foreign ambassadors, nine Academy Award winners, three
Pulitzer Prize winners, and twenty-eight Olympic medalists. Overall, twelve
Nobel laureates are affiliated with the university. McGill University is one of
two member-universities of the Association of American Universities situated
outside the United States.

As of the 2012-2013 school year, McGill was ranked 1st in Canada among all its
major/research universities offering medical and doctoral degrees in the
Maclean's 22nd annual rankings, maintaining this position for the eighth
consecutive year. http://oncampus.macleans.ca/education/2012/11/01/2013-medical-
doctoral/ Internationally, McGill ranked 18th in the world and 1st in
Canada the 2012 QS World University Rankings . Bloomberg
BusinessWeek's 2012 Business Schools Ranking ranked McGill's Desautels Faculty
of Management 10th in the world among non-US business schools. McGill
was ranked 34th in the world and 3rd in Canada by the Times Higher Education
World University Rankings, and 60th in
the world and 3rd in Canada in the Academic Ranking of World Universities. In
the 2011 Emerging/Trendence Global Employability Ranking, McGill was ranked 19th
in the world, and 1st in Canada, for popularity among major employers.

In 2012, Travel + Leisure rated McGill's campus as one of the 16 most beautiful
university campuses in the world. http://www.travelandleisure.com/articles/worlds-most-beautiful-
universities/4. The main campus is set upon at the foot of Mount Royal in
Downtown Montreal, covering much of the Golden Square Mile. A second campus, the
Macdonald Campus, is situated on of fields and forested land in Sainte-Anne-de-
Bellevue, west of the downtown campus. With 21 faculties and professional
schools, McGill offers degrees and diplomas in over 300 fields of study,
including medicine and law. Although the language of instruction is English,
students have the right to submit any graded work in English or in French,
except when learning a particular language is an objective of the course.
Approximately 38,000 students attend McGill, with international students
comprising one-fifth of the student population.
